reviewText:
Campus Girls takes place after graduation when Tina Russell is speaking to her mother on the phone, thanking her mom for putting her through school. After the phone conversation ended, Russell and her boyfriend Rick (Marc Stevens) gossip about their classmates sex lives.

The opening scene between Marlene (Judy Gillis) and Ralphie showed promise. Marlene slowly caresses Ralphie's chest as she slowly takes her time toward giving him a bj. Nice flute music playing throughout the scene. Russell has a nice solo scene twenty-two minutes into the movie. Rick leaves to get a sandwich for a few minutes and she takes matters into her own hands. Russell had good chemistry with Rick in the final scene. They did every position: oral, doggy style, girl on-top, and missionary. However, beyond the opening scene, Tina's solo, and the finale between Tina and Rick, the rest of the scenes was filler.

The hippies Jeff and Joyce both had fit, muscular bodies and were both very hairy, making it difficult to know who was the man and who was the woman. Coupling problems with the scene, the lighting was dimly lit. In Janice's threesome with the jocks, one of the jocks, Bill Pruner, kept chatting incessantly throughout. It wasn't dirty talk, it was nonsensical comments such as, "Don't let anything happen to this girl," and, "If the boys back home can see us now, they would turn green with envy." He also said, "Outta sight," no less than five times!

The special features includes trailers for the upcoming DVD releases of Hot Honey and Misbehavin,' and an interview with Ron Jeremy. I like the interview with Jeremy. He was candid about what it was like working with Lil' Oral Annie and working on the set of Inside Seka.

Memorable performances from Tina Russell and Judy Gillis but the rest of the scenes in Campus Girls was forgettable.

No story, no sexually introduction, crude with poor sound a visual quality. Just raw sex, but not even good in that respect.
Could have shot this trashy film in a couple of days.
